intro: Matricaria apetala, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Matricaria apetala is often used in herbal medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
